result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tre T. Creamer

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 16, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

1:07 PM Defendant Tre T. Creamer appeared by video.  Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared by video for Tre T. Creamer.  Attorney Corinne Frutiger in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Riek gives argument in support of motion to modify bond.
Atty Frutiger gives argument opposing any modification of bond.  In the event the Court grants the motion, Atty Frutiger requests $10,000 cash and the addition of a co-signer to the bond.
Court denies the motion to modify bond; orders that bond remain as previously set.
Set for status conference 11/16/22 at 1:45 p.m.

2:33 PM 
Defendant Tre T. Creamer in court.  Attorney Amanda K. Riek in court for Tre T. Creamer.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Detective Erik Longseth.
**Erik Longseth is affirmed and testifies.
Direct examination by DA Gill.
Cross examination by Attonrey Riek.
Re direct by DA Gill.
Re cross by attorney Riek

State moves for bind over.
Attorney Riek argues against bind over and moves for dismissal.

Court finds probable cause and orders bind over.

Information is filed.
Formal reading is waived.

"NOT GUILTY" entered.

Parties argue bond modification.

Court Denies bond modification for reasons stated on the record.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
